relation: Added support for latest CTagsHighlighter and Java bracket highlighting
Better support for latest ctags highlighter.
Added support for latest ctags highlighter (which uses EnumerationValue instead of Enumerator).
Added some protection against creating erroneous highlight groups.
Added more colour groups and automatic reloading of colour scheme when changes are written.
Added colouring of sign column and splits.
Added custom colouring of more groups, including the status line and the line numbering area.
textBeforeTable: script versions (upload new version) Click on the package to download. Life Changing Helpful Unfulfilling  rate this script   install details   This is the colour scheme that I use for all editing tasks.  It is primarily designed for use with a dark background (as I find this easier on the eyes), but I'm gradually adding more support for light backgrounds as well.  It makes full use of the available colour palette, so looks better in gvim than in console vim (although I still like the console version). More details (and screenshots) at https://sites.google.com/site/abudden/contents/Vim-Scripts/bandit-colour-scheme Unusual Features The colour scheme has a few slightly unusual features as Vim colour schemes go: Support for a lot more highlighting groups than most colour schemes (including the result of the ctags-based highlighter: vimscript#2646, and Dr Chip's rainbow.vim). Requires Vim 7 or above (I got irritated by the syntax for colour schemes, so I made my own) If you install the associated syntax file, it is self colouring, so you can see the colour scheme clearly when viewing
